Posts.Content: This type of issue seems to be all to common. Really would hope there are answers for these kinds of issues. Sounds eerily similar to my girlfriends issues.
Posts.Title: Burning sensation and pain in left breast

Posts.Content: update - still some redness however doctors were next to useless as to why redness and pain was so prevalent.Â  their only course of action was repeated anti-biotics which did not do anything.
Posts.Title: Breast pain, redness, over 2 months

Posts.Content:
2 ultrasounds, long round of IV antibiotics, another ultrasound, biopsy...great news (all things considered) negative for Cancer. Lymph nodes all clear as well. Still no clue what problem is and it's not getting better.
Never fully understood the fear involved in going through something like this but hopefully this turns outgoing be a fully treatable condition.
Really believe a site like this is of tremendous value. Bev keep up the great work! 
Patrickb - hope your wife's situation is similar. Makes you appreciate life a lot more.
Posts.Title: Breast pain, redness, over 2 months

Posts.Content:
Think maybe I used the wrong words...what I meant was that I never fully appreciated how our view of what is important in life can change so quickly and irrevocably. The frustration with trying to find answers and sudden inward looking is challenging.
Emerg again today. No answers or recommendations. Managed to get follow up MRI.
Again thanks Bev for being there.
Posts.Title: Breast pain, redness, over 2 months

Posts.Content: Thanks Gayle. Amazing how different the world of medicine is in your imagination until you actually have to rely on it for serious illness. Harsh way to learn.
Posts.Title: Breast pain, redness, over 2 months

Posts.Content:
Lol! She said something along those lines about
 two days later when she was woke up without exceutiating pain. 
You're absolutely right on the anti-biotics side. Can either make it worse or actually initiate it when good bacteria balance is thrown off.
Interestingly I also came across a number of papers that suggested that cancers may have strong links to fungal balance problems. The whole mechanics of the body really is a fairly delicate balance.
Lots of love to all in the forum and I'm thinking good thoughts for all.
Posts.Title: Breast pain, redness, over 2 months

Posts.Content:
My girlfriend has had extremely sore right breast, large red patch extending from niple downward. Nipple is a bit puffy. Two (very painful) mammograms and a thorough ultrasound have not shown anything. She did a 10 day course of antibiotics that threw her digestive system into a tailspin.
There is a family history of cancer. She is scheduled for a biopsy now but only by insisting with the doctors.
I am very concerned but trying to be strong for her. Any thoughts on how I can best support her would be appreciated.
Also any ideas on what this could be? Please explain acronyms - I'm a guy who doesn't have any knowledge of this stuff.
Update - pain so bad I'm thinking of taking her to emergency. Pretty scary.
Posts.Title: Breast pain, redness, over 2 months
